greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square table read by antidiagonals of number of ways of arranging n chords on a circle with k simple intersections (i.e., no intersections with 3 or more chords).
comment: Columns include A000108 (Catalan) for k=0 and A002694 for k=1.
link: H. Bottomley, Illustration for A000108, A001147, A002694, A067310 and A067311
J. Touchard, Sur un problème de configurations et sur les fractions continues, Canad. J. Math., 4 (1952), 2-25, g_n(x).
example: i.e., there are 5 ways of arranging 3 chords with no intersections, 6 with one, 3 with two and 1 with three.
xref: A067311 has a different view of the same table.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jan 14 2002
